Carlos Tokarski

Game Developer

Resume

About Me

I'm a 23 years old game developer from Frankfurt, Germany, and I've been developing video games for the past four years.
I am currently a Animation & Game student at the University of Applied Sciences in Darmstadt, Germany.

I'm experienced in most areas of game development such as 3D modeling and animation, Technical Art, Game Design and Production Management but my main area of expertise is Programming. While working on front-end logic such as User Interfaces or Gameplay logic has been my main responsibility during most projects, I do enjoy designing and implementing back-end game systems or creating tools or little helpers for my teammates to work with and ease development.

Over the past four years I have accumulated experience over several projects, some of which I worked on by myself and some in teams of up to four people. During my studies I have also been in the positions of lead programmer and visionkeeper, managing smaller teams of four people. I would describe myself as very sociable and I love meeting new people and learning new things.

Education

University of Applied Sciences in Darmstadt

Animation & Game - September 2017 - Present

Animation and Game encompasses character design and storytelling, 2D and 3D animation, game development and programming. Over seven semesters, students work in a practical and interdisciplinary way to acquire the wide range of technical, conceptual and design skills needed for the development and production of animated films, series and games.
  • Three games created in a team of four
  • One solo developed game
  • Two Programming courses (Game Development)
  • Two Technical Art courses
  • Two Production Management courses
  • Several courses covering Legal issues, Game Design, Animation and Drawing
  • Five electives including shader programming, C++ engine development, ui/ux design and game design

Mission Insignia

In Mission Insignia two players work together in a coop VR puzzle game to overcome the unforeseen crisis of an explosion that is threatening the success of the mission. Inspiried by the real life lunar mission, Apollo 13, the two players take on the roles of ground control and astronaut. While ground control must instruct the astronaut on how to restore power inside the capsule the astronaut must inform ground control about the situation and together they must avert the failure of the oxygen supply.

C# Unity Virtual Reality Team

IMCognito

IMCognito is 2.5D spy game in which you take on the role of an undercover Stasi informant working for the Ministry of State Security. You are tasked with keeping an eye on your neighbours and report any suspicious or anti government behaviour to your higher ups, but whether you follow said orders is up to you. Earn the government's rewards and goodwill if you do so, or risk your own hide by secretly covering up for your neighbours.

C# Unity Team
